comments.body: If I am understanding, this is just a stand-in for "is device X mounted at path Y" ?  If that became easier to ask, this could become that, right?

yes.  Implementation based on this:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10410513/function-or-a-systemcall-similar-to-mountpoint-command-in-linux

If there's a better way, I'm 100% open to it.
I ask because part of my volume plugins PR is a mount-tools pkg, which could answer this question, but is obviously much more heavy-weight.

Is it possible to AttachDisk twice, once readonly, and once read-write?  It seems like it isn't since the device name is fixed regardless of the mode.  What happens if a pod that needs diskFoo RO is scheduled on the machine first, and then one that needs it RW?

The second attach will fail, we should have stuff to prevent the pods from scheduling (predicate fit function).

I'd rather add that in a separate PR, but I can add it here if you prefer.
